Looking at the Visual Diff Window

Visual Diff allows you to compare two text files or revisions by color-coding the differences between them.  It synchronizes vertical and horizontal scrolling of the two files. Also, if the Visual Diff window is resized, it  automatically readjusts the displayed files so that they appear side by side.

 

 

At the top of the window, Visual Diff displays the names and revision numbers of the files being compared. The file on the left is considered the file to which you are making the comparison.

A splitter bar separates the compared files into two vertical or horizontal panes. You can drag this bar to adjust the amount of window space is allocated for each pane. Visual Diff remembers the last vertical and last horizontal locations of the bar and uses them the next time you split the screen. If you move the bar to the edge of the window, Visual Diff shows the two files as one file in a single pane.

By using a variety of colors and font styles, Visual Diff makes it easy to see the differences between files. The default colors and styles are:

  • Blue (italicized) indicates changed (and, therefore, conflicting) blocks of text.

  • Red text with strikethrough indicates deleted blocks of text.

  • Green indicates inserted blocks of text.

  • Black indicates matching blocks of text.

These defaults can be changed by selecting  Edit > Options from the menu and selecting the Color tab.

At the bottom of the window, the status bar shows the position of the cursor within the text by line and character numbers.

Changing the Window Appearance

To change the appearance of the Visual Diff window, you can display, hide, or move the toolbar or display or hide the status bar.

To display or hide the toolbar:

  1. Select Search > Options from the menu bar. The Options menu opens.

  2. Select the Display Toolbar check box to display the toolbar, or clear it to hide the toolbar.

To move the toolbar:

Drag the toolbar to any location on or off the Visual Diff window. If the location is an edge of the Visual Diff window, the toolbar docks there. Otherwise, the toolbar floats.

To display or hide the status bar:

  1. Select Search > Options from the menu bar. The Options menu opens.

  2. Select the Display Status Bar check box to display the status bar, or clear it to hide the status bar.
